After being made aware of the report, Knight quickly tweeted that he was alive and well.<ref>{{cite news| url=http://www.boston.com/news/source/2014/03/not_dead_actor_wayne_knight_lastest_victim_of_web_death_hoax.html | work=The Boston Globe | first=Jack | last=Pickell | title=Not dead: Actor Wayne Knight latest victim of web death hoax | date=March 16, 2014}}</ref> *'''Janina Kolkiewicz''': In November 2014, this 91-year-old Polish woman's family found her to be without a pulse. A doctor was summoned, and she was declared dead after examination. A death certificate was issued, and her body was brought to a morgue. However, mortuary workers called several hours later to report that she was alive. She was eventually allowed to return home.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/news/world-europe-30048087|title=Polish woman declared dead wakes up in mortuary|work=BBC News}}</ref> *'''[[Larry Kramer]]''': in December 2001, the gay rights activist was reported dead by [[Associated Press]] following a liver transplant.<ref>[http://findarticles.com/p/articles/mi_m1589/is_2002_Feb_5/ai_82322819 Dahir, M.: "Larry gets a liver – but who's next?"] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20060217052823/http://www.findarticles.com/p/articles/mi_m1589/is_2002_Feb_5/ai_82322819 |date=February 17, 2006 }}, ''[[The Advocate (LGBT magazine)|The Advocate]]'', February 5, 2002.</ref>
==L== [[File:Lee Kuan Yew.jpg|thumb|A [[Death hoax#Politician death hoaxes|death hoax]] website reported false news of [[Lee Kuan Yew]]'s death.]] *'''Xavier LaBelle''' was wrongly reported as one of the fatalities in the [[Humboldt Broncos bus crash]]. While he was unconscious, he was wrongly identified as Parker Tobin, and Tobin's body was identified as his, a situation similar to that of [[Whitney Cerak]].<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/saskatchewan/coroner-mixup-humboldt-broncos-fatal-collision-1.4668594|date=2018-05-18|accessdate=2018-07-13|publisher=CBC News|title='I'm not Parker Tobin': Humboldt Broncos player revealed ID mix-up, coroner says: Xavier LaBelle and Parker Tobin misidentified in aftermath of crash}}</ref> *'''[[Bobby Labonte]]''', a [[NASCAR]] driver, was reported dead in 2001 and in 2002 in traffic accidents. This was a mix-up after Bobby's father-in-law had died.<ref>[https://news.google.com/newspapers?nid=1734&dat=20020604&id=yvEbAAAAIBAJ&sjid=FVMEAAAAIBAJ&pg=4827,2828368 Bobby Labonte deals with unfounded rumors].</ref> *'''[[W. S. Lach-Szyrma]]''', a [[curate]] and pioneering writer of [[science fiction]], became ill during a visit to Paris and on his return to [[Cornwall]] found that his obituary had been published in several papers. He is credited as the first writer to use the word ''[[Martian]]'' as a noun.<ref>Pool, P. A. S. (1974) ''The History of the Town and Borough of Penzance.'' Penzance: Corporation of Penzance.</ref> Lach-Szyrma died in 1915. *'''[[Artie Lange]]''', comedian from ''[[The Howard Stern Show]]'', was reported dead in May 2004 by [[KLAS-TV]] in Las Vegas. The show was being broadcast from Las Vegas, and Stern show prank caller Captain Janks capitalized on Artie's debauched reputation by telling the news station that he was a representative from the Hard Rock Hotel, and that Artie had been found dead in his hotel room.<ref>[http://www.lasvegasweekly.com/news/archive/2004/may/13/channel-8-killed-artie-lange/ Silver, Kate: "Channel 8 Killed Artie Lange"], ''Las Vegas Weekly'', May 13, 2004.</ref> *'''Betsy Langjahr''': In January 2016, Pennsylvania police reported that an unidentified dead body found in 1973 may have been that of Betsy Langjahr, who was a missing teenage runaway at the time. However, police soon received a number of tips alerting them to the fact that Langjahr was in fact still alive.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.nydailynews.com/news/national/woman-police-linked-body-found-1973-alive-article-1.2398174|title=Woman police linked to body found in 1973 is still alive|publisher=|accessdate=April 23, 2018}}</ref> * '''Ryan Lanza''' was initially reported as the perpetrator of a [[Sandy Hook Elementary School shooting|mass murder-suicide]] in [[Newtown, Connecticut]] on December 14, 2012. It was in fact Ryan's younger brother, Adam Lanza, who had stolen his brother's identification and committed the murder-suicide.<ref name="Rumors fly in Hoboken about brother of suspected Connecticut school shooter">{{cite web|last1=Grant|first1=Jason|last2=Frassinelli|first2=Mike|title=Rumors fly in Hoboken about brother of suspected Connecticut school shooter|url=http://www.nj.com/news/index.ssf/2012/12/confusion_reigns_at_hoboken_bu.html|work=The Star Ledger|date=December 15, 2012|accessdate=December 22, 2012}}</ref> *'''[[Martin Lawrence]]''': in March 2015, a [[fake news website]] reported that the comedian had been found dead in a hotel room.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.snopes.com/inboxer/hoaxes/martinlawrence.asp | title=Martin Lawrence Death Hoax | publisher=[[Snopes]] | accessdate=October 25, 2016}}</ref> *'''[[Guillaume Le Gentil]]''' left Paris to head towards [[Pondicherry]] in 1760. He faced numerous delays and troubles and was unable to return until 1771, when he found that he had been declared legally dead. Le Gentil died in 1792. *'''[[Lee Kuan Yew]]''', first [[Prime Minister]] of Singapore. On March 18, 2015, a [[Death hoax#Politician death hoaxes|death hoax]] website reported false news of Lee's death.<ref>{{cite web|title=Student who posted fake PMO announcement on Mr Lee Kuan Yew's death given stern warning|url=http://www.straitstimes.com/news/singapore/more-singapore-stories/story/student-who-posted-fake-pmo-announcement-mr-lee-kuan-yew|website=http://www.straitstimes.com/|accessdate=April 8, 2015}}</ref> He died five days later. *'''[[Titan Leeds]]''', publisher of an [[almanac]] competing with [[Benjamin Franklin]]'s ''[[Poor Richard's Almanac]].'' Franklin had repeatedly predicted that Leeds would die in 1733 in his almanac, and when the date of Leeds' supposed passing had come and gone, published Leeds' obituary anyway. When Leeds actually died in 1738 Benjamin Franklin publicly commended the impostors for ending their charade. (See the somewhat similar case of [[List of premature obituaries#P|John Partridge]].)<ref>[http://www.litencyc.com/php/sworks.php?rec=true&UID=2617 Lena, A.: "Poor Richard's Almanack"], ''The Literary Encyclopedia''.</ref> *'''[[Kimo Leopoldo]]''', [[mixed martial arts]] fighter, was the subject of numerous premature obituaries on July 21, 2009. Internet reports that Leopoldo had died after complications from a [[heart attack]] late in the evening on July 20 were picked up and republished by a large number of mainstream media outlets, including ''[[The Huffington Post]]'', [[TMZ.com|TMZ]], the ''[[New York Daily News]]'', ''[[The Orange County Register]]'', and ''[[USA Today]]''.<ref name=medina>Medina, Mark. "[http://www.latimes.com/sports/la-sp-kimo-leopoldo22-2009jul22,0,485261.story Kimo Leopoldo is still alive]", The Los Angeles Times, July 22, 2009.</ref> *'''[[Jerry Lee Lewis]]''', the rock-and-roll and country musician, was confused with the similarly named comedian, actor, filmmaker and humanitarian [[Jerry Lewis]], who died on August 20, 2017. An early CNN.com obituary of the comedian mistakenly used the musician's name in the headline, and Google searches for "Jerry Lee Lewis death" incorrectly indicated that he had died.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.huffingtonpost.com/entry/jerry-lee-lewis-google-death_us_599c6c82e4b06a788a2c3613 |title=Hey Google, Jerry Lee Lewis Is Still Alive! |last=Moye |first=David |work=The Huffington Post |date=August 22, 2017 |accessdate=August 23, 2017}}</ref> *'''[[Gordon Lightfoot]]''', Canadian folk musician, was mistakenly reported dead by [[CBC Radio 3]], [[Canwest]] and the ''[[Calgary Herald]]'' on February 18, 2010. The source of the rumour was a prank phone call to [[Ronnie Hawkins]], a long time friend of Lightfoot's, by a man claiming to be the singer's grandson. Media outlets ran the story having confirmed with Hawkins. Lightfoot was in fact at the dentist at the time the story broke.<ref>[http://www2.canada.com/windsorstar/news/story.html?id=9ff6d350-b289-48b1-b7fa-0b1eab8cf210 Gordon Lightfoot 'death' a hoax] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120627185356/http://www2.canada.com/windsorstar/news/story.html?id=9ff6d350-b289-48b1-b7fa-0b1eab8cf210 |date=June 27, 2012 }}, The ''Windsor Star'', February 19, 2010.</ref> * '''Arthur Livingston''' – The then-36-year-old resident of [[Prosperity, South Carolina]], was erroneously reported dead by his bank, [[Bank of America]], when he sold his house in May 2009. {{as of|2012|February}}, neither the bank nor the three credit agencies who recognized the false death report have corrected the error, which has caused difficulties for Livingston in his attempts to gain credit.<ref>[http://www.670kboi.com/rssItem.asp?feedid=114&itemid=29798100 Bank of America Declared Customer Dead for Three Years?] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120213185517/http://www.670kboi.com/rssItem.asp?feedid=114&itemid=29798100 |date=February 13, 2012 }}. ''Cumulus Media''. Retrieved February 12, 2012.</ref> *'''[[Bill Lockwood (cricketer)|Bill Lockwood]]''', a former English [[Test cricket]]er, had an obituary erroneously published by ''[[The Register (Adelaide)|The Register]]'', a South Australian newspaper, in November 1927,<ref>[http://nla.gov.au/nla.news-article54936020 "W. H. LOCKWOOD: Well-known Cricketer's Death."] – ''The Register''. Published November 17, 1927.</ref> over four years before his actual death in April 1932.<ref>[http://www.espncricinfo.com/england/content/player/16328.html Bill Lockwood] – ESPNcricinfo. Retrieved January 7, 2013.</ref>
==M== [[File:Paul McCartney on stage in Prague.jpg|thumb|[[Paul McCartney]] was [[Paul is dead|reported dead]] on American radio in 1969.]] *'''[[Claude Maxwell MacDonald]]''', was the British minister in Beijing during the [[Boxer Rising]] in 1900, and had his obituary published in "[[The Times]]" along with those of other prominent foreigners in the city. MacDonald died in 1915. *'''[[Ralph Macchio]]''', famous for ''[[The Karate Kid]]'', was the subject of a death hoax. In January 2013, a hoax article claimed that he had died in a snowboarding accident in [[Switzerland]]. The same hoax was also recirculated in March 2014.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.snopes.com/inboxer/hoaxes/snowboarddeath.asp | title=Snowboard Death Hoax | publisher=[[Snopes]] | accessdate=October 27, 2016}}</ref> *'''[[Lonnie Mack]]''', the rock guitarist best known as the founder of the [[blues-rock]] guitar genre, was lamented as recently deceased in the Foreword to the 1997 book, ''Rock Music in American Popular Culture''. Although rarely seen in recent years, the notoriously reclusive Mack was still very much alive, and performed as a headliner at the [[Rock & Roll Hall of Fame]] as recently as November 15, 2008.<ref>See, English Wikipedia article on Lonnie Mack</ref> Mack died in 2016.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://blogs.post-gazette.com/arts-entertainment/pop-noise/46490-rip-blues-guitar-great-lonnie-mack|title=RIP blues guitar great Lonnie Mack|first=Scott|last=Mervis|publisher=|accessdate=April 23, 2018}}</ref> *'''[[Iven Mackay]]''', an Australian general, received an obituary in ''[[The Times]]'', entitled "Athlete, Soldier and Headmaster", as a result of a case of mistaken identity following the death of Major General James Alexander Kenneth Mackay in 1935.<ref>{{Cite journal | last = Chapman | first = Ivan D. | title = Iven G. Mackay: Citizen and Soldier | year = 1975 | publisher = [[Melway]] publishing | location = [[Malvern, Victoria]] | oclc = 2346434 |page=2 | postscript = . }}</ref> Mackay died in 1966. *'''[[John Madden]]''' the Hall of Fame coach was reported dead on April 29, 2014, by ''Empire News,'' convincing many sports fans before being disproved.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.snopes.com/john-madden-death-hoax/|title=FALSE: Hall of Fame Coach John Madden Dead at 78|last=Evon|first=Dan|newspaper=snopes|language=en-US|access-date=January 18, 2017}}</ref> *'''[[Nelson Mandela]]''' (South African leader) was reported as having died in an article on the [[Deutsche Welle]] website on June 14, 2013.<ref>{{Cite news |title=South Africa mourns Nelson Mandela |url=http://www.dw.de/south-africa...mandela/a-15796097 |date=June 14, 2013 |accessdate=June 14, 2013 }}{{dead link|date=September 2017 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}</ref> The site later blamed this on an unspecified "technical difficulty".<ref>{{Cite news|title=South Africans pray for Mandela |url=http://www.dw.de/south-africans-pray-for-nelson-mandela/a-16884279 |date=June 14, 2013 |accessdate=June 14, 2013 }}</ref> He was also one of those whose undated obituaries were released in the [[#The CNN.com incident|CNN.com incident]]. Mandela died in December 2013. *'''[[Charles Manson]]''': On May 15, 2015, a fake news website reported that the notorious criminal had been found dead in his prison cell. A similar hoax story that surfaced on September 14 of that year also proclaimed the same thing.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.snopes.com/inboxer/hoaxes/manson.asp | title=Charles Manson Death Hoax | publisher=[[Snopes]] | accessdate=October 25, 2016}}</ref> Manson died of natural causes on November 19, 2017.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.rollingstone.com/culture/news/charles-manson-dead-at-83-w458873|title=Charles Manson Dead at 83|publisher=|accessdate=April 23, 2018}}</ref> *'''[[Vanni Marcoux]]''', French baritone, was incorrectly reported as having died in World War I in 1914. He actually died in 1962.<ref>{{Cite news|author= |title=French Baritone Killed. Vanni Marcoux of Boston Opera Company Was in the French Army. |url=https://query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=9E04E5D7143EE033A25754C1A9669D946596D6CF |quote=Word was received here today that Vanni Marcoux, a member of the Boston Opera Company, had been killed while fighting in the French Army. ...|work=[[The New York Times]] |date=October 17, 1914 |accessdate=September 23, 2010 }}</ref> *'''[[Jerry Maren]]''', American actor best known as one of the Munchkins in the 1939 film version of ''[[The Wizard of Oz (1939 film)|The Wizard of Oz]]''. Several news outlets, including the Examiner, cited social media reports that Maren, the last surviving Munchkin from the film, had died on February 29, 2016, but Maren appeared on social media (in what would be his last appearance) to disprove the reports.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.inquisitr.com/2842383/ding-dong-the-last-munchkin-is-gone/|title=Ding Dong, The Last Munchkin Is Gone. Or Is He?|publisher=www.inquisitr.com|date=March 1, 2016|accessdate=March 1, 2016}}</ref> Maren died on May 24, 2018 from a combination of old age-related diseases.<ref>{{cite web |last1=Peitt |first1=Stephanie |title=Wizard of Oz's Last Surviving Munchkin Jerry Maren Dies at 98 |url=https://people.com/movies/last-surviving-munchkin-wizard-of-oz-dies-98-jerry-maren/ |website=PEOPLE.com |accessdate=6 June 2018 |language=en}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |last1=Barnes |first1=Brooks |title=Jerry Maren, Who Sang and Danced as a Munchkin in Oz, Dies at 98 |url=https://www.nytimes.com/2018/06/06/arts/jerry-maren-dead-wizard-of-oz-munchkin.html |website=The New York Times |accessdate=6 June 2018 |date=6 June 2018}}</ref> *'''[[Eleanor Markham]]''': an American woman, one of the most prominent cases of an averted [[premature burial]] in the late 19th century. She was pronounced dead on July 8, 1894 in [[Sprakers, New York]] however woke up in her coffin 2 days later en route to the graveyard on July 10, 1894.<ref name="1912-one">(October 13, 1912). [http://chroniclingamerica.loc.gov/lccn/sn83045433/1912-10-13/ed-1/seq-26/ Burial Alive is Bugaboo Of the Average Person], ''Washington Herald''</ref> *'''[[Gabriel García Márquez]]''' (writer), reported dead by Peruvian daily ''[[La República]]'' in 2000 shortly after being diagnosed with cancer.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.museumofhoaxes.com/day/05_09_2001.html|title=The Death of Lou Reed|publisher=}}</ref> A number of newspapers also published his alleged farewell poem, but Márquez denied being the author of the piece and even went as far as to say that he was upset that people could think he wrote something so tacky. It soon emerged that the poem was actually written by a Mexican man, who commented that he did not think himself to be a great writer but still was upset that his poem had been attributed to someone else.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://elpais.com/diario/2000/06/01/cultura/959810408_850215.html|title=García Márquez: "Lo que me mata es que crean que escribo así"|author=Ediciones El País|work=EL PAÍS}}</ref> Márquez underwent successful treatment for his cancer and lived long enough to write and publish the first volume of an autobiography.<ref>{{cite news| url=https://www.nytimes.com/2002/10/09/books/a-storyteller-tells-his-own-story-garcia-marquez-fighting-cancer-issues-memoirs.html | work=The New York Times | first=Juan | last=Forero | title=A Storyteller Tells His Own Story; García Márquez, Fighting Cancer, Issues Memoirs | date=October 9, 2002}}</ref> He died of pneumonia on April 17, 2014, at the age of 87. * '''Johnny Sterling Martin''': to avoid paying child support, in 1979 this American persuaded a relative to call a family court and claim that Martin had died in a bar fight. In January 2006, following a tip-off by an ex-wife, he was located 150 miles (240 km) away where he had been living under his real name. He was arrested and jailed. During the intervening decades his child support bill had risen to $30,000.<ref>[http://www.msnbc.msn.com/id/10924038/from/ET/ "Police: Man faked death to avoid child support"], [[MSNBC]], January 19, 2006.</ref> * '''[[Karl Marx]]''': On September 6, 1871, ''[[The New York Times]]'' reported the German philosopher to be dead. Marx actually died in 1883.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.nytimes.com/times-insider/2015/08/06/1871-karl-marxs-premature-obituary/|title=1871: Karl Marx's Premature Obituary|last=Bulik|first=Mark|date=August 6, 2015|website=The New York Times|access-date=January 18, 2017}}</ref> * '''Alison Matera''': in 2006 this Florida woman told fellow church choir members that she had cancer, and over the course of 11 months gave them reports of her treatment, culminating in the claim that she was near death and would be going into a hospice. She subsequently made further phone calls masquerading as a hospice nurse, then as Matera's sister, claiming that Matera had died. The church arranged a memorial service – to which Matera showed up, again claiming to be her sister. Suspicions had already been aroused from the phone calls, in which the nurse and sister both sounded exactly like Matera. Police did not arrest her as no crime had been committed; she blamed her behaviour on childhood trauma.<ref>[http://www.sptimes.com/2007/02/02/Hernando/Woman_s_tragic_tale_j.shtml Lake, T.: "Woman's tragic tale just a tale after all"], ''[[St Petersburg Times]]'', February 2, 2007.</ref> Matera really did die a few years later on June 15, 2011.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.legacy.com/obituaries/tbo/obituary.aspx?n=alison-matera&pid=152119661|title=ALISON MATERA|work=TBO.com}}</ref> * '''Mary Mather''', a paediatrician who was reported dead in December 2004 by the [[General Medical Council]] after confusion with another person of the same name.<ref>[http://www.bmj.com/cgi/content/full/330/7496/912 Mather, M.: "Die another day"], ''[[British Medical Journal]]'', April 16, 2005</ref> *'''[[Jerry Mathers]]''': rumours that the ''[[Leave it to Beaver]]'' actor had been killed in Vietnam spread to newspapers by December 1969. (Claims that [[Associated Press]] and [[United Press International]] put out the story, and that it arose from confusion with the death of another soldier called Mathers, appear to be false.)<ref>[http://www.snopes.com/radiotv/tv/mathers.asp "Believe it to Beaver"], Snopes.com.</ref> *'''[[Brian Matthew]]''': On April 5, 2017, the [[BBC]] reported that the radio presenter had died the previous night. They later updated to say that he was critically ill, but alive.<ref>{{cite web|title=Updated statement regarding Brian Matthew|url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/mediacentre/statements/brian-matthew|publisher=[[BBC]] Press Office}}</ref> He died a few days later, on April 8.<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/entertainment-arts-39541162 |title=Brian Matthew: BBC Radio 2 broadcaster dies at 88|publisher=BBC News|date = April 8, 2017|access-date=April 8, 2017}}</ref> *'''[[Dave Matthews]]''': in 2003, a fake news website reported that the musician had died of a drug overdose.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.snopes.com/inboxer/hoaxes/matthews.asp | title=Dave Matthews | publisher=[[Snopes]] | accessdate=October 27, 2016}}</ref> *'''[[Paul McCartney]]''' was proclaimed dead in 1969 (though McCartney was supposed to have been killed in 1966) by a caller to radio DJ [[Russ Gibb]]'s show on [[WDTW (AM)|WKNR-FM]] Detroit. A few days later New York DJ [[Roby Yonge]] was fired for discussing McCartney's possible death on a late-night show. These and other incidents led to [[Paul is dead|interminable rumours]] that McCartney's supposed death (hinted at by a trail of supposed clues in various [[Beatles]] songs) had been covered up and he had been replaced by a look-alike.<ref>Reeve, A.J.: ''Turn Me On, Dead Man: The Beatles and the "Paul is Dead" Hoax''. AuthorHouse Publishing, 2004. {{ISBN|9781-4184-82947}}</ref> *'''[[Mark McGrath]]''', actor and lead singer of [[Sugar Ray]], was the subject of a deliberate death hoax; to promote the TV series ''[[Hot Package]]'', production company Prismatics issued a press release claiming McGrath had been shot to death during production of the show. (It was in fact his character that was [[kill off|killed off]].)<ref>Ruggiero, Nina (February 26, 2015). [http://www.amny.com/entertainment/mark-mcgrath-death-hoax-sugar-ray-frontman-is-alive-and-well-1.9980121 Sugar Ray's Mark McGrath is not dead, but a creepy press release wants us to think he is]. ''AM New York''. Retrieved February 27, 2015.</ref> *'''Sipho William Mdletshe''', a South African man who was thought to have died in a 1993 traffic accident. After spending two days in a metal box in a mortuary, he was freed when his cries alerted workers. However, his fiancée refused to see him thereafter, believing he had turned into a zombie.<ref name="snopes">[http://www.snopes.com/horrors/gruesome/buried.asp "Just dying to get out"], Snopes.com</ref> *'''[[John Mellencamp]]''': In December 2012, it was reported on the internet that the singer had died. The report was picked up by some media outlets before Mellencamp's representatives officially declared it to be a hoax. *'''[[Thomas Menino]]''': as an [[April Fool's Day]] prank in 1998, shock jocks [[Opie and Anthony]] claimed on [[WAAF (FM)|WAAF-FM]] radio that the [[Boston]] mayor had died in a car accident. Several local media outlets picked up on the story and reported it as true, causing a media firestorm that eventually led to the pair being fired. However, fan support resulted in [[Gregg Hughes|Opie]] & [[Anthony Cumia|Anthony]] getting a job in New York.<ref>[https://select.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=F10F15FB39550C708DDDAE0894D0494D81 Adelson, A.: "On-air prank earns pair a shot at radio big time"], ''[[The New York Times]]'', July 13, 1998.</ref> Menino later died in October 2014. *'''Bertrand Meyer''' was proclaimed dead by the Heise News Ticker in 2005. ''See [[Bertrand Meyer#Wikipedia hoax|Bertrand Meyer English Wikipedia Hoax]]''. *'''[[Bret Michaels]]''': In December 2014, a hoax article claimed that the singer had died in a jet ski accident.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.snopes.com/inboxer/hoaxes/jetskideath.asp | title=Jet Ski Death Hoax | publisher=[[Snopes]] | accessdate=October 27, 2016}}</ref> *'''[[Cesar Millan]]''': On December 2, 2014, a fake news website reported that the famous "[[Dog Whisperer with Cesar Millan|Dog Whisperer]]" had died of a heart attack.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.snopes.com/inboxer/hoaxes/cesarmillan.asp | title=Cesar Millan Dead? | publisher=[[Snopes]] | accessdate=October 27, 2016}}</ref> *'''Donald E. Miller, Jr.''': After mysteriously disappearing and failing to pay child support, this Ohio man was legally declared dead in 1994. However, it turned out that Mr. Miller had simply left the state, and in 2013 he asked a judge to reverse the declaration of death so he could apply for a driver license. The judge was unable to honor this request, as Ohio law states that a declaration of death cannot be reversed after more than three years have passed. As such, Miller remains legally dead {{as of|2013|October|lc=y}}. Further complicating the matter is the fact that Miller's ex-wife received Social Security benefit payments for their children for several years, and she might be required to return them if the declaration of death is reversed.<ref>{{cite news|last=Schwartz|first=John|title=Declared Legally Dead, as He Sat Before the Judge|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2013/10/12/us/declared-legally-dead-as-he-sat-before-the-judge.html|newspaper=The New York Times|date=October 11, 2013}}</ref> *'''Prasad''' and '''Mahaprasad Mishra''' (Indian brothers) were officially declared dead in 1979 by four nephews in order to steal their land in [[Uttar Pradesh]]. Although the nephews were forced to admit fraud, the case was mired in legal delays for many years. The Mishra brothers' 'deaths' were finally annulled in 1999 (by when Prasad had reached the age of 75) after intervention by the [[Association of the Dead]], an organisation that protests such cases. (See also [[List of premature obituaries#B|Lal Bihari]].)<ref name="time.com"/><ref name="tribuneindia.com"/> *'''[[Kel Mitchell]]''' was falsely declared dead in widely circulated internet messages in July 2006 due to unknown causes.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.snopes.com/radiotv/tv/kelmitchell.asp|title=snopes.com: Kel Mitchell Death|publisher=}}</ref> *'''[[George Monbiot]]''' (environmentalist and writer) was once declared clinically dead in Lodwar General Hospital in north-western Kenya after contracting [[cerebral malaria]]. He recovered.<ref>[http://www.monbiot.com/archives/2000/06/09/about-george-monbiot/ George Monbiot official web site] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20070530005815/http://www.monbiot.com/archives/2000/06/09/about-george-monbiot/ |date=May 30, 2007 }}, retrieved June 1, 2007.</ref> *'''[[Joe Montana]]''': In August 2013, a hoax news article claimed that the former [[San Francisco 49ers|49ers]] quarterback had been killed in a car crash.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.snopes.com/inboxer/hoaxes/cardeath.asp | title=Celebrity Car Crash Hoax | publisher=[[Snopes]] | accessdate=October 27, 2016}}</ref> *'''[[Ron Moody]]''' (actor best known as Fagin in the film ''[[Oliver! (film)|Oliver!]]'') was reported dead twice (according to ''[[The Times]]'', June 12, 2015<ref>{{cite news|title=Times Diary – Dead Again|newspaper=The Times|date=June 12, 2015}}</ref>): ''[[Hello!]]'' magazine reported in 1993 that he had died of a stroke, and in 2010 "a piece in a London paper about famous residents of Southgate reported that the actor had died four years earlier". Moody was quoted as saying: "I'm bloody annoyed. Not only can it cause unhappiness, but it can affect your work. If people think you're dead they're not going to use you. Unless it's a kinky film." Moody died on June 11, 2015. * '''Peter Moran''' (British journalist) was reported dead in the December 2007 issue of aviation magazine ''[[FlyPast]]''; he had previously contributed to the magazine for several years. This was apparently due to confusion with another aviation writer of the same name, and was corrected in the January 2008 issue.<ref>''[[FlyPast]]'' December 2007 & January 2008.</ref><ref>[http://forum.keypublishing.co.uk/archive/index.php?t-75616.html Discussion on The Aviation Forum], November 2007.</ref> *'''[[Harry Mulisch]]''': On August 6, 2009, the Dutch writer was falsely declared dead by a Dutch [[Teletext]] service, after which some news websites took over the news.<ref>{{nl icon}} [http://frontpage.fok.nl/nieuws/117131/-Teletekst-blundert-met-dood-Harry-Mulisch.html Teletekst blundert met dood Harry Mulisch] (FOK.nl nieuws, visited August 6, 2009)</ref> He died in 2010. *'''Declan Murphy''': The jockey fell during a race at [[Haydock Park Racecourse]] in 1994, and was trampled by a horse behind him. He slipped into a coma, and was revived hours before a decision on whether to switch off his life-support system was due to be made. Murphy resolved to return to racing after reading his obituary in the ''[[Racing Post]]''.<ref>{{Citeweb|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/magazine-39507939|title=The jockey who raced again after reading his own obituary|publisher=BBC News|accessdate=April 6, 2017|date=April 6, 2017}}</ref> *'''Paul Mutora''': In January 2014, this Kenyan man was declared dead after having swallowed insecticide to kill himself. However, morgue workers noticed movement in his body and discovered that he was in fact still alive.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/news/world-africa-25681048|title=Kenyan 'corpse' wakes up in Naivasha mortuary|work=BBC News}}</ref> *'''[[Levy Mwanawasa]]''': On July 3, 2008, the [[Johannesburg]]-based 702 Talk Radio claimed that the [[President of Zambia]] had died in a Paris hospital while recovering from a stroke suffered 4 days before in [[Egypt]]. The government stated that the story was false.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.bloomberg.com/apps/news?pid=20601116|title=Zambian President Mwanawasa Is Alive, Government Says (Update1)|work=[[Bloomberg L.P.|Bloomberg]]|date=July 3, 2008|accessdate=July 3, 2008}}</ref> Mwanawasa died 47 days later from complications of the stroke.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/world/africa/7570285.stm |title=BBC NEWS – Zambia's president dies in France |date = August 20, 2008 |accessdate=August 19, 2008 | work=BBC News}}</ref>
==N== [[File:Alfred_Nobel3.jpg|thumb|[[Alfred Nobel]] bequeathed his fortune to institute the [[Nobel Prizes]] after reading a damning premature obituary]] *'''[[K. R. Narayanan]]''' (former [[President of India]] 1997–2002): while in critical condition in the morning of November 9, 2005, his death was rumoured by some TV channels and later known to be false. Narayanan died later the same day. The problem arose as he was in a gravely ill condition due to [[Pneumonia]] and age-related complications. *'''[[Jayaprakash Narayan]]''': while hospitalized in March 1979, the politician's death was erroneously announced by India's prime minister, causing a brief wave of national mourning, including the suspension of parliament and regular radio broadcasting, and closure of schools and shops. The mistake arose when the director of the Intelligence Bureau saw a body looking like Narayan being carried from hospital.<ref name="Pile, S. 1979"/> Narayan died in October 1979. *'''[[Judd Nelson]]''': On October 26, 2014, it was reported that the actor and ''[[Brat Pack (actors)|Brat Pack]]'' member was found dead in his Los Angeles home. Nelson later took to Twitter with a recently printed newspaper to dispel such rumors.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.usmagazine.com/celebrity-news/news/judd-nelson-death-hoax-freaks-people-out-actor-sends-proof-of-life-20142710|title=Judd Nelson Death Hoax Freaks People Out, Actor Sends Proof of Life|date=October 27, 2014|publisher=|accessdate=April 23, 2018}}</ref> *'''[[Willie Nelson]]''': On February 21, 2015, a fake news website reported that the legendary country singer had been found dead at his home. A similar hoax story surfaced in August of that year that proclaimed the same thing.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.snopes.com/inboxer/hoaxes/willienelson.asp | title=Willie Nelson Death Hoax | publisher=[[Snopes]] | accessdate=October 25, 2016}}</ref> *'''[[Alfred Nobel]]''' (arms manufacturer and founder of the [[Nobel Prize]]): in 1888, the death of his brother Ludvig caused several newspapers to publish obituaries of Alfred in error. A French obituary stated ''Le marchand de la mort est mort'' ("The merchant of death is dead")<ref name="Brit1">{{cite web|url=http://www.britannica.com/EBchecked/topic/416842/Alfred-Bernhard-Nobel|title=Alfred Bernhard Nobel|work=Encyclopædia Britannica}}</ref> and that Nobel "became rich by finding ways to kill more people faster than ever before"<ref name="TIME20001016" /> through his invention of [[dynamite]]. This distressed Nobel, who was concerned that when he truly died he would not be remembered well. This event led him to bequeath the bulk of his estate to form the Nobel Prize in 1895. Nobel died in 1896. * '''Joseph Norton''': the death of the 89-year-old [[University at Albany]] professor emeritus was incorrectly reported in the Summer 2007 edition of the university's alumni magazine. When asked whether he knew anyone who wanted him dead, Norton replied, "I haven't any idea. There might well be. I've been rather active in the gay world, which not everybody approves of." Norton died in 2011.<ref>[http://timesunion.com/AspStories/story.asp?storyID=627192&category=CAMPUSCOL&BCCode=&newsdate=10/4/2007 Parry, M.: "Former U of Albany prof's obituary was premature"] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20071103132741/http://timesunion.com/AspStories/story.asp?storyID=627192&category=CAMPUSCOL&BCCode=&newsdate=10%2F4%2F2007 |date=November 3, 2007 }}, ''[[Albany Times-Union]]'', October 4, 2007.</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.albany.edu/pr/ualbanymagfall07/AlumniNewsNotesFall07.pdf |format=PDF |title=Correction |page=51 |work=UAlbany magazine, Fall 2007}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.legacy.com/obituaries/timesunion-albany/obituary.aspx?n=joseph-l-norton&pid=151193043 |title=Joseph Norton Obituary |work=legacy.com}}</ref> *'''[[Ted Nugent]]''' (musician and activist) was falsely declared dead by [[fake news]] site The Last Line of Defense in May 2017.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://hosted.ap.org/dynamic/stories/N/NOT_REAL_NEWS?SITE=AP&SECTION=HOME&TEMPLATE=DEFAULT&CTIME=2017-05-06-10-45-44|title=News from The Associated Press|website=hosted.ap.org|accessdate=April 23, 2018}}</ref>
==O== *'''Nicholas O'Connor''': this Boston comedian spent months planting hints about a future suicide and then went missing. After over a week of having convinced his fans of his death, he made a dramatic public appearance, performed an album recording and then went on a sold out tour throughout the United States. *'''Grady O'Cummings''': this civil rights activist and political candidate had his own obituary published in [[The New York Times]] and [[New York Amsterdam News]] in 1969. Four months later he held a news conference at which he stated that he had faked his own death due to threats against him and his family by members of the [[Black Panther Party]]. O'Cummings died on June 2, 1996.<ref>{{cite news |last1=Canedy |first1=Dana |last2=Eveleigh |first2=Darcy |title=A Politician's Rise, Fall, And ... |url=https://www.nytimes.com/2017/02/25/us/grady-o-cummings-black-politician.html |accessdate=March 5, 2017 |work=[[The New York Times]] |date=February 26, 2017 |page=A12}}</ref> *'''[[Maureen O'Hara]]''': the film actress was listed as dead on the [[Internet Movie Database]] in 1998, apparently due to confusion with actress [[Maureen O'Sullivan]].<ref name="Dead People Server">{{cite web|url=http://dpsinfo.com/dps/rumors.html|title=Dead People Server|author=Laurie D. T. Mann|publisher=}}</ref> O'Hara died on October 24, 2015.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/news/entertainment-arts-34628502|title=Actress Maureen O'Hara dies aged 95|date=October 24, 2015|publisher=|accessdate=April 23, 2018|via=www.bbc.com}}</ref> *'''[[Mark O'Shea (herpetologist)|Mark O'Shea]]''': the television snake expert was reported killed by a 14-year-old King cobra which struck his foot at West Midland Safari Park, UK on August 19, 2012. The cobra, was being fed thawed rats when it stuck O'Shea's shoe, venom soaking into his sock and entered his system via abrasions on his foot, rather than through fang punctures. The symptoms were relatively mild but he was hospitalised as a precaution due to the high yield and toxicity of king cobra venom. He was discharged the following day.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://topnews.net.nz/content/223952-king-cobra-kills-snake-handler|title=King Cobra Kills a Snake Handler – TopNews New Zealand|publisher=}}</ref> *'''[[Barack Obama]]''': on July 4, 2011, a hacker collective called "The Script Kiddies" took control of [[Fox News]]'s politics [[Twitter]] feed and posted that the incumbent President had been assassinated during a campaigning event in Iowa.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/americas/fox-news-tweets-death-of-president-obama-2306997.html|title=Fox News tweets death of President Obama|first=Enjoli|last=Liston|date=July 5, 2011|accessdate=July 5, 2011|work=[[The Independent]]|location=London}}</ref> *'''[[Hiroo Onoda]]''': this Japanese soldier survived for decades in the Philippines jungle, believing that World War II had not ended. Onoda, with three other soldiers who accompanied him for some years, continued to fight the war, killing many local Filipinos. Although numerous attempts were made (''e.g.'', by leaving leaflets) to persuade them that the war was over, every such effort was regarded as an enemy trick. Onoda – who was officially declared dead in 1959 – only gave himself up in 1974 when his commanding officer, who had long since retired from the military and become a bookseller, was sent to the island to order Onoda to surrender. He returned to Japan a national hero, and wrote a book ''No Surrender: My Thirty-Year War''.<ref>For references see [[Hiroo Onoda]]</ref> Onoda died on January 16, 2014, at the age of 91. *'''[[Sharon Osbourne]]''': in October 2004, a draft obituary of rock star [[Ozzy Osbourne]]'s wife was accidentally published on the [[ABC News]] web site owing to a technical error.<ref>[http://www.sfgate.com/cgi-bin/article.cgi?f=/gate/archive/2004/10/12/ddish.DTL "Osbourne obituary mistake"], ''[[San Francisco Chronicle]]'' web site, October 12, 2004.</ref>
==P== [[File:Tom Petty 2016 - Jun 20.jpg|thumb|Musician [[Tom Petty]] was prematurely reported dead by [[CBS News]] and other outlets after being found in full cardiac arrest in October 2017. He died later that day.]] *'''[[Al Pacino]]''': On May 10, 2015, a fake news website reported that the actor had been found dead in his home at the age of 75.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.snopes.com/inboxer/hoaxes/alpacino.asp | title=Al Pacino Death Hoax | publisher=[[Snopes]] | accessdate=October 25, 2016}}</ref> *'''[[Valentin Paniagua]]''' (former Peruvian president): was reported dead by congressman [[Víctor Andrés García Belaúnde]] during a speech being made by Peru's Prime Minister [[Jorge Del Castillo]] to the Peruvian Congress in August 2006. 15 minutes later, Paniagua's attending physician announced that the former president had been admitted to the Intensive Care Unit but was alive and recovering.<ref>[http://www.livinginperu.com/news/2345 "False announcement of Peruvian ex-President's death interrupts plenary session"], ''Living in Peru'', August 24, 2006.</ref> He died in October 2006. *'''[[Eduardo Paolozzi]]''': the artist's death was incorrectly reported in a magazine when he suffered a near-fatal stroke in 2001.<ref>[http://www.timesonline.co.uk/tol/comment/obituaries/article384305.ece "Sir Eduardo Paolozzi"], ''[[The Times]]'', April 23, 2005.</ref> He died in 2005. *'''[[John Partridge (astrologer)|John Partridge]]''', an astrologer whose death [[Jonathan Swift]] (writing under a pseudonym) 'predicted' in a 1708 hoax almanac and later 'confirmed', prompting numerous anti-Partridge newspaper obituaries. (See also [[List of premature obituaries#L|Titan Leeds]].)<ref>''The Concise Oxford Companion to English Literature'', Oxford University Press, 2003.</ref> He died in either 1714 or 1715. *'''[[Joe Paterno]]''': The former head coach of the [[Penn State Nittany Lions football]] team from 1966 to 2011 had been hospitalized in serious condition for complications from [[lung cancer]], a [[Twitter|tweet]] by [[Pennsylvania State University]]'s student blog ''Onward State'' on the evening of January 21, 2012, reported that Paterno had died. This information was picked up by [[CBS Sports]], and other news outlets soon followed, while CBS eventually removed the story after members of the Paterno family denied the reports of Joe's death. Later that night, ''Onward State''{{'}}s managing editor Devon Edwards officially retracted the story, stating that "In this day and age, getting it first often conflicts with getting it right, but our intention was never to fall into that chasm. All I can do now is promise that in the future, we will exercise caution, restraint, and humility." Devon also announced that he would immediately resign from his position as managing editor for ''Onward State''. Other reports at the time indicated Paterno had been taken off his respirator and given [[Last Rites]], which the Paterno family also denied.<ref name="torontostar-hoax">{{cite news|last=McKnight|first=Zoe|title=Despite Internet claims, Paterno not dead at 85|url=https://www.thestar.com/article/1119321--despite-internet-claims-paterno-not-dead-at-85|publisher=[[The Toronto Star]]|accessdate=January 22, 2012|date=January 21, 2012}}</ref><ref name="onwd-paterno">{{cite web|last=Edwards|first=Devon|title=An Apology from the Managing Editor of Onward State|url=http://onwardstate.com/2012/01/21/a-letter-from-the-managing-editor-of-onward-state/|publisher=Onward State|accessdate=January 22, 2012}}</ref> Paterno died the next morning.<ref>{{cite news|title=Legendary Penn State coach Paterno dead at 85|url=http://www.cnn.com/2012/01/22/us/pennsylvania-obit-paterno/index.html|date=January 22, 2012 | work=CNN}}</ref> * '''Sidney Patrick''': an American who was allegedly taken on board a UFO in 1965, was incorrectly said to be dead by ufologist Timothy Good in his 1996 book ''Beyond Top Secret''. Good corrected the mistake in a subsequent book.<ref>Good, T.: ''Need to know: UFOs, the military and intelligence'' p.251, Sidgwick & Jackson, 2006.</ref> * '''Natalya Pavlova''': this Lithuanian 27-year-old went missing in November 2007, and was declared dead a few weeks later when a body found in a forest was identified by her parents as hers. However, in January 2008 she turned up alive when she was arrested for shoplifting in the city of [[Klaipėda]]. It turned out that she had been living there with her boyfriend. It was not known who the dead woman was.<ref>[http://uk.reuters.com/article/newsOne/idUKL1610505620080116 "Lithuanian police ask suspect: aren't you dead?"], [[Reuters]], January 16, 2008.</ref> *'''[[Pelé]]''': the Brazilian soccer player was erroneously reported dead by a Twitter account linked to [[CNN]]'s morning show, ''[[New Day (TV program)|New Day]]'', on March 28, 2014. The report was retracted after Pelé himself confirmed he was still alive.<ref>Yoder, Matt (March 28, 2014). [http://awfulannouncing.com/2014/cnn-reports-peles-death-pele-confirms-he-is-in-fact-alive.html CNN reports Pele's death, Pele confirms he is in fact alive]. ''AwfulAnnouncing.com''. Retrieved March 28, 2014.</ref> *'''[[Sean Penn]]''': On January 12, 2016, Buzzfeed.net and Daily Media Buzz reported that the actor had been found murdered in his home.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.snopes.com/sean-penn-death-hoax/|title=FALSE: Sean Penn Found Dead|last=Evon|first=Dan|newspaper=snopes|language=en-US|access-date=January 18, 2017}}</ref> *'''[[Peret]]''': on August 27, 2014, Spanish newspapers published that the singer had died. National press agency EFE and the Catalan government published reports about his death. Two hours later, his family announced that Peret was seriously ill but not dead. Another two hours later, newspapers again announced his death, this time confirmed by his manager.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://cultura.elpais.com/cultura/2014/08/27/actualidad/1409136705_670558.html|title=Muere a los 79 años el cantante Peret, padre de la rumba catalana|author=Ediciones El País|date=August 27, 2014|work=EL PAÍS}}</ref> * '''Vuk Peric''': a Serbian pensioner who put his own death notice in the newspaper in 1997 to see who would turn up to his funeral. After watching the funeral from a distance, he revealed himself and thanked everyone for attending.<ref>"Serbian who faked his own funeral now selling his grave", [[Ananova]], November 8, 2002, cited in [http://www.leonardrossiter.com/reginaldperrin/Real.html Reggie Online].</ref> *'''[[William Perry (American football)|William "The Refrigerator" Perry]]''': In 2013 Perry's death was erroneously reported by TigerNet, a fan site of the [[Clemson Tigers football]] team, who confused the former NFL defensive tackle with another person named William Perry. Perry was, at the time, watching his former team, the [[Chicago Bears]], play a preseason game against the [[Carolina Panthers]].<ref>Mitchell, Fred (August 14, 2013). [http://www.chicagotribune.com/sports/football/bears/chi-chicago-bears-william-fridge-perry-20130814,0,164155.story William 'Fridge' Perry 'doing fine' despite erroneous death report]. ''Chicago Tribune''. Retrieved August 14, 2013.</ref> *'''[[Tom Petty]]''': After the singer and songwriter was hospitalized after being found in full [[cardiac arrest]] on October 2, 2017, several news outlets, such as [[CBS News]], ''[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]]'', ''[[Rolling Stone]]'' and ''[[Entertainment Weekly]]'' reported that he had died.<ref>{{cite web|last1=Koblin|first1=John|title=Premature CBS Report of Tom Petty's Death Sets Off an Outpouring|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2017/10/02/business/media/tom-petty-cardiac-arrest.html|website=The New York Times|accessdate=October 4, 2017|date=October 2, 2017}}</ref> The [[Los Angeles Police Department]] was named as the source for the report, but moments later, the department announced that incorrect information had been provided to the media and they were not in the position to confirm Petty's death.<ref>{{cite web|last1=News|first1=ABC|title=Initial erroneous Tom Petty death reports cause confusion|url=http://abcnews.go.com/Entertainment/wireStory/los-angeles-police-deny-confirming-tom-pettys-death-50241445|website=ABC News|accessdate=October 4, 2017|language=en}}</ref> He died later that day, with confirmation being made through an official family statement provided to the ''[[Los Angeles Times]]''.<ref>{{cite web|last1=Lewis|first1=Randy|title=Tom Petty, Heartbreakers frontman who sang 'Breakdown,' 'Free Fallin'' and other hits, dies at 66|url=http://www.latimes.com/local/lanow/la-me-tom-petty-20171002-story.html|website=Los Angeles Times|accessdate=October 3, 2017|date=October 2, 2017}}</ref> * '''Jim Pierce''': this resident of [[Smackover, Arkansas]] was thought to have died in 1926 when a body identified as his by over 50 people was found in an empty railroad oil tank car. His son took the corpse back to Texas for burial, but was met there by Jim Pierce, very much alive. It was not clear who the dead man was.<ref>[http://www.tituscemeteries.com/historicnews01.html "Man thought to be dead appears before the corpse is buried"], ''Mount Pleasant Daily Times'', April 20, 1926, cited on TitusCemeteries.com.</ref> * '''Samy Pillai''': a Malaysian man who was certified dead in June 2005 after his wrecked motorcycle was found near an unidentifiable body. In March 2007 it was discovered that he had in fact survived the accident when he was found 300 km away, partly paralysed and unable to speak; his identity was confirmed by thumbprints. It was not known what he had been doing in the intervening two years.<ref>[http://today.reuters.co.uk/news/articlenews.aspx?type=oddlyEnoughNews&storyid=2007-03-19T043606Z_01_KLR26035_RTRIDST_0_OUKOE-UK-MALAYSIA-REUNION.XML "'Dead' Malaysian returns home after two years"]{{dead link|date=May 2017 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}, [[Reuters]], March 19, 2007.</ref> *'''[[Harold Pinter]]''': on October 13, 2005 the newsreader on [[Sky News]], apparently relaying information she was having difficulty hearing on her earpiece, announced that the writer had died. (She also mispronounced his name, and described him as a 'play writer'.) She rapidly corrected this to report that in fact he had won the [[Nobel Prize]] for literature.<ref>[http://www.iht.com/articles/2005/10/13/news/nobel.php Lyall, S.: "Pinter awarded Nobel"], ''[[International Herald Tribune]]'', October 14, 2005.</ref> Pinter lived until December 2008. *'''[[Perry Pirkanen]]''': see [[List of premature obituaries#B|Luca Barbareschi]]. *'''[[Joe Piscopo]]''': according to the 2008 book ''Truth and Rumors: The Reality Behind TV's Most Famous Myths'', Piscopo was once the subject of a premature obituary. However, no further details are given.<ref name="books.google.com"/> *'''[[Velupillai Prabhakaran]]''': the [[Tamil Tiger]] leader was reported by the [[Sri Lanka Broadcasting Corporation]] as being among the dead or missing in the [[2004 Indian Ocean earthquake|December 2004 tsunami]]. This was taken by many to suggest that he was specifically dead. The corporation later retracted the report.<ref>[http://news.indiainfo.com/2005/01/09/0901lanka.html "Sri Lanka radio retracts report about Prabhakaran"] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20061017231140/http://news.indiainfo.com/2005/01/09/0901lanka.html |date=October 17, 2006 }}, Indiainfo.com, January 9, 2005.</ref> He was killed in a battle against Sri Lankan Army troops in May 2009. *'''[[Ray Price (musician)|Ray Price]]''': Numerous media outlets, from ''[[Rolling Stone]]'' to the ''[[USA Today]]'', reported the country music legend had died from cancer on December 15, 2013. The information came from Price's son, Cliff, who posted via Facebook his father's apparent passing, but it was later retracted, according to ''[[The Tennessean]]'' (which also published a news story on Price's death that was later removed).<ref>{{cite web |url=http://popcultureblog.dallasnews.com/2013/12/reports-of-country-legend-ray-prices-death-have-been-premature.html/ |title=Archived copy |accessdate=December 15, 2013 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131216012749/http://popcultureblog.dallasnews.com/2013/12/reports-of-country-legend-ray-prices-death-have-been-premature.html/ |archivedate=December 16, 2013 |df= }} Wilonsky, Robert, "Reports of country legend Ray Price's death have been premature", ''[[Dallas Morning News]]'', December 15, 2013. Retrieved December 16, 2013</ref> Price died the next day, with a family spokesman confirming the death.<ref>Cooper, Peter, "Ray Price, famed for his country shuffle, dies at 87", ''[[USA Today]]'', December 16, 2013. Retrieved December 16, 2013 [https://www.usatoday.com/story/life/music/2013/12/15/country-singer-ray-price-dies-obituary/2963323/]</ref> {{anchor|Q}}
==R== *'''Augie Ratner''', a former featherweight boxer, published his own obituary in the ''[[Minneapolis Star-Tribune]]'' in 1971. A skeptical [[John McNally (American football)|Johnny Blood McNally]] called Ratner out on the bluff, and the two would later place a $1,000 bet, legally placed in each other's will, on who would survive longer.<ref>{{cite news |work=Sports Illustrated |title=People |date=October 4, 1971 |url=http://sportsillustrated.cnn.com/vault/article/magazine/MAG1085364/index.htm }}</ref> Ratner died in 1979, thus making McNally (who died in 1985) the winner. *'''[[Ronald Reagan]]''' (former US President), in the [[#The CNN.com incident|CNN.com incident]]. CNN also included fragments of Reagan's life history in a premature obituary of [[Fidel Castro]] in the same incident. Reagan died on June 5, 2004. *'''[[Lou Reed]]''' (musician), reported dead by numerous US radio stations in 2001, caused by a hoax email (purporting to be from [[Reuters]]) which said he had died of a drug overdose. Reed died on October 27, 2013.<ref>[http://www.museumofhoaxes.com/day/05_09_2001.html "Death of Lou Reed"], Museum of Hoaxes web site</ref> *'''[[Adam Rich]]''': the television actor was reported to have been murdered in a 1996 tribute issue of ''[[Might magazine|Might]]'' magazine. It was all an elaborate hoax by the magazine's editor [[Dave Eggers]] in collusion with Rich, and was intended to satirize the media exploitation of stars who die young.<ref>[http://www.salon.com/media/media960506.html Eggers, D.: "He's hot, he's sexy, but he isn't dead"] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20061201093930/http://www.salon.com/media/media960506.html |date=December 1, 2006 }}, Salon.com</ref><ref>Eggers, D.: ''[[A Heartbreaking Work of Staggering Genius]]'', Simon and Schuster, 2000.</ref> *'''Diana Rodriguez''': In November 2015, this [[Queens, New York]] woman was declared dead after having shot herself in a suicide attempt. It was later discovered that she was still breathing, but she did actually die several hours later.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://theforumnewsgroup.com/2015/11/18/suicidal-richmond-hill-woman-mistakenly-declared-dead/|title=Suicidal Richmond Hill Woman Mistakenly Declared Dead – The Forum Newsgroup|website=theforumnewsgroup.com|accessdate=April 23, 2018}}</ref> *'''[[Axl Rose]]''': On December 3, 2014, a fake news report circulated on the internet claiming that the singer had been found dead at home. In response, Rose tweeted "If I'm dead do I still have to pay taxes?"<ref>{{cite web|url=http://ultimateclassicrock.com/axl-rose-death-hoax/|title=Axl Rose Debunks Death Hoax, Hints at New Guns N' Roses Music|work=Ultimate Classic Rock}}</ref> * '''Raymond Roth''', a 47-year-old man from [[Massapequa, New York]], was reported missing on July 28, 2012, after having gone for a swim off [[Jones Beach State Park|Jones Beach]]. After an extensive search turned up nothing, Roth was initially presumed dead. He was found alive several few days later, apparently having faked his own death to claim on life insurance policies.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://newyork.cbslocal.com/2012/08/15/raymond-roth-once-missing-jones-beach-swimmer-expected-to-turn-himself-in/|title=Raymond Roth, Once-Missing Jones Beach Swimmer, Arrested « CBS New York|publisher=}}</ref> Roth was arrested in March 2013, when he was arrested for [[police impersonation|impersonating a police officer]] and attempting to lure a woman into his van. He received a prison sentence for both crimes in April 2014.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://newyork.cbslocal.com/2014/04/24/raymond-roth-sentenced-for-faking-death-impersonating-police/|title=Raymond Roth Sentenced For Faking Death, Impersonating Police|publisher=}}</ref> *'''[[Amnon Rubinstein]]''', Israeli academic and retired politician, whose death was announced in 1999 by Knesset (parliamentary) speaker [[Avraham Burg]] following a hoax telephone call. Rubinstein was in hospital at the time for a minor complaint.<ref>[http://www.stiffs.com/backjul99.html "Israeli parliament fooled by false death notice"] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20070104080920/http://stiffs.com/backjul99.html |date=January 4, 2007 }}, Stiffs.com, July 29, 1999.</ref> *'''[[Chumlee|Austin Lee Russell]]''', American television personality better known as '''Chumlee''', was the victim of at least two death hoaxes. On May 14, 2013, a fake news article reported that Chumlee had died of a [[marijuana]] overdose. Another hoax article that surfaced in March 2014 claimed that he died of a heart attack.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.snopes.com/inboxer/hoaxes/chumlee.asp | title=Chumlee Death Hoax | publisher=[[Snopes]] | accessdate=October 27, 2016}}</ref> *'''[[Bertrand Russell]]''': the philosopher was reported dead in the Japanese press in 1920 when he was suffering from pneumonia.<ref>[http://www.edinformatics.com/great_thinkers/russell.htm "Bertrand Russell"], edinformatics.com</ref> Some sources say the reports were a deliberate form of revenge by Japanese journalists whom Russell had refused to meet due to his illness. His supposed death may also have been reported in ''[[The Times]]''. (It is also sometimes said that by way of apology, ''The Times'' allowed Russell to pre-write his own obituary for publication on his actual death. But the obituary<ref>[http://www.aam314.vzz.net/Russell.html Obituary of Bertrand Russell], ''[[The Times]]'', February 1970.</ref> does not read as if it could be by him; the confusion may be that in 1937 he wrote an imaginary ''Times'' obituary for his own entertainment, which is briefly quoted at the end of his obituary in ''The New York Times''.<ref>[https://www.nytimes.com/books/01/04/29/specials/russell-obit.html Whitman, A.: "Bertrand Russell is dead"], ''[[The New York Times]]'', February 3, 1970.</ref>) Russell died in 1970. * '''Bob Ruthman''': Ruthman, an author who was a roommate of journalist [[Andy Rooney]] during their time at [[Colgate University]] in the 1930s, was falsely reported dead by [[TMZ (website)|TMZ]] after experiencing a heart attack and being prematurely pronounced dead while at Rooney's funeral in November 2011. Ruthman was later revived, and the numerous news reports indicating his death were corrected within two hours.<ref>[http://www.huffingtonpost.com/2011/11/09/andy-rooney-college-roommate-dies-memorial_n_1084744.html Andy Rooney's College Roommate Bob Ruthman Nearly Dies At His Memorial (UPDATE)]. ''The Huffington Post''. Retrieved November 9, 2011.</ref> Ruthman died nine days later.
==S== [[File:Bob Seger 2013.jpg|thumb|upright|Rock Musician [[Bob Seger]], was the subject of a false obituary, after he was confused with folk music veteran [[Pete Seeger]]]] *'''[[Saif al-Islam Gaddafi]]''' (son of former [[Libya]]n leader [[Muammar Gaddafi]]) Although it was widely reported at the time that Saif al-Islam Gaddafi had been captured or killed by NTC forces during the concluding stages of the [[Battle of Sirte (2011)|Battle of Sirte]] on October 20, 2011, these reports appeared to be false due to the fact that shortly after his father was killed, the Libyan prime minister Mahmoud Jibril said that Saif al-Islam Gaddafi had managed to escape and was on the run.<ref>{{cite news|last=Bell |first=Melissa |url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/blogs/blogpost/post/saif-gaddafi-reported-dead-by-al-arabiya/2011/10/20/gIQApxun0L_blog.html |title=Saif Gaddafi on the run, Libyan prime minister says – BlogPost |publisher=The Washington Post |date=October 20, 2011 |accessdate=October 28, 2011}}</ref> *'''Hugo Jose Sanchez''' This British father of four was a web developer for [[HMV]] and faked his death to claim £850,00 and get his family out of poverty. He was caught when a friend bought an [[Elvis Presley|Elvis]] CD, and used Sanchez's HMV discount. This sparked an investigation, and his life insurance company found Hugo's fingerprints on his own death certificate. Both him and his wife were subsequently arrested.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-2151225/HMV-worker-faked-death-bid-live-dream-lifestyle-Costa-Rica-claiming-850-000.html|title=Jailhouse rock: HMV worker who faked his own death for £850,000 caught after Elvis CD purchase|newspaper=Mail Online|access-date=December 12, 2016}}</ref> *'''[[Gabe Saporta]]''', the Uruguayan-born lead singer of the American pop-rock band [[Cobra Starship]], was the subject of a death hoax in August 2008 that included a fake [[MTV News]] page and death certificate. Saporta debunked the rumor himself on his Myspace page.<ref>{{cite web|last1=Johnston|first1=Maura|title=Gabe Saporta: Not Dead|url=http://www.idolator.com/400225/gabe-saporta-not-dead|website=Idolator|accessdate=September 23, 2016|date=August 12, 2008}}</ref> *'''[[Ben Savage]]''', an American actor, was reported dead in a car accident in September 2006. The hoax report is believed to have originated on MySpace.<ref name="books.google.com"/> *'''[[Jimmy Savile]]''' (broadcaster) in 1994, when then-DJ [[Chris Morris (satirist)|Chris Morris]] announced on [[BBC Radio 1]] (as a joke) that he had collapsed and died. Savile began legal action against Morris. He actually died on October 29, 2011, two days before his 85th birthday. (See also [[List of premature obituaries#H|Michael Heseltine]].)<ref name="news.bbc.co.uk"/> *'''[[Terri Schiavo]]''': a draft of the brain damaged patient's obituary accidentally appeared briefly on [[CBS]]'s web site on March 28, 2005, in advance of her death.<ref>[https://web.archive.org/web/20050406081214/http://www.sun-sentinel.com/news/local/southflorida/sfl-330schiavoobit%2C0%2C837464.story?coll=sfla-home-headlines CBSNews.com's draft Schiavo obit found on Internet], ''Chicago Sun-Sentinel'', March 30, 2005.</ref> Schiavo died from starvation on March 31, 2005, after removal of her [[feeding tube]] on March 18, 2005. *'''[[Arthur M. Schlesinger, Jr.]]''' (historian): his death was referred to in the ''[[Pittsburgh Post-Gazette]]'' on November 29, 2005. The newspaper retracted the reference on December 2, saying, "We are embarrassed but happy for Mr Schlesinger."<ref>''[[Pittsburgh Post-Gazette]]'', November 29, 2005 and December 2, 2005.</ref> Schlesinger died February 28, 2007. *'''[[Arnold Schwarzenegger]]''': On August 28, 2015, it was reported that the actor had died from a heart attack at 68. The rumor originated with a fake news website.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.snopes.com/arnold-schwarzenegger-dead/ | title=Arnold Schwarzenegger Death Hoax | publisher=[[Snopes]] | accessdate=October 29, 2016}}</ref> *'''[[Steven Seagal]]''': This American actor was the subject of at least two death hoaxes. In May 2013, a fake Facebook page titled "R.I.P. Steven Seagal" fooled social media users, and another false report from August 2015 claimed that he died of a massive heart attack.<ref>{{cite web | url=http://www.snopes.com/inboxer/hoaxes/seagaldead.asp | title=Steven Seagal Death Hoax | publisher=[[Snopes]] | accessdate=October 25, 2016}}</ref> *'''[[James Ford Seale]]''', who took part in the 1964 [[Ku Klux Klan]] murder of two black hitchhikers in Mississippi, was found not far away in 2005 – despite newspapers including ''[[The Clarion-Ledger]]'' having reported him dead, apparently because Seale's family had said he was. Seale was located by the brother of one of the victims, and was convicted in 2007, having previously had all charges dropped when the case was originally investigated.<ref>[http://www.clarionledger.com/crimes/moore1-14.html Mitchell, J.: "'66 Klan slaying not only killing on federal property"], ''[[The Clarion-Ledger]]'', January 14, 2000.</ref><ref>[http://www.blackamericaweb.com/site.aspx/bawnews/seale125 "White former deputy thought to be dead charged in 43-year-old murder of two black men"] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20071102185421/http://www.blackamericaweb.com/site.aspx/bawnews/seale125 |date=November 2, 2007 }}, [[Associated Press]], January 25, 2007.</ref> Seale died on August 2, 2011. *'''[[Bob Seger]]''': After the death of folk singer [[Pete Seeger]] on January 27, 2014, a number of confused Twitter and Facebook users posted tributes to rock singer Bob Seger instead. Others, apparently believing that Bob Seger was Pete Seeger's son, offered condolences to Bob on the loss of his father. The two singers were in fact of no known relation, and Bob Seger was very much alive and well.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://ultimateclassicrock.com/pete-seeger-bob-seger-twitter/|title=Pete Seeger's Death Prompts Confused Twitter Tributes to a Very Much Alive Bob Seger|work=Ultimate Classic Rock}}</ref> *'''[[Katharine Sergava]]''' (''[[Oklahoma!]]'' actress & dancer), whose obituary was published in 2003 in the ''[[Daily Telegraph]]'' and a few days later in ''[[The New York Times]]''. The latter newspaper blamed the former for the mistake.<ref>[https://query.nytimes.com/gst/fullpage.html?res=9906E5D6163DF937A35751C1A9659C8B63 "Katharine Sergava, the Star Of 'Oklahoma!' Ballet, Dies"], ''The New York Times'', December 4, 2003.</ref> Sergava died November 26, 2005 *[[William H. Seward|'''William Seward''']] After the assassination of [[Abraham Lincoln]], on April 15, 1865, many newspapers erroneously reported that William Seward and other members of [[Lincoln's cabinet]] had been killed, with the [[New York Herald]] reporting "Washington was thrown into intense excitement a few minutes before eleven o'clock this evening, by the announcement that the President and Secretary Seward had been assassinated and were dead''."''<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/lifestyle/style/abraham-lincolns-assassination-great-joy-then-a-gunshot/2015/03/27/3e93b202-cbe0-11e4-a2a7-9517a3a70506_story.html|title=Abraham Lincoln's assassination: Great joy, then a gunshot|last=Achenbach|first=Joel|date=March 27, 2015|newspaper=The Washington Post|language=en-US|issn=0190-8286|access-date=December 11, 2016}}</ref> Seward died in 1872. *'''[[Big Brother 10 (UK)#Housemates|Rebekah Shelton]]''', former ''[[Big Brother (UK TV series)|Big Brother]]'' contestant, was reported to have died on January 12, 2018 following a message posted on her [[Twitter]] account. Shelton claimed the account had been hacked.<ref>{{cite web|title=Big Brother star Rebekah Shelton not dead after 'hack'|url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/newsbeat/article/42667304/big-brother-star-rebekah-shelton-not-dead-after-hack|website=Newsbeat|publisher=[[BBC]]|accessdate=April 18, 2018}}</ref> *'''[[Jaclyn Smith]]''' (''[[Charlie's Angels]]'' actress & model) was reported to have shot herself in Honduras in 2009. The rumor began when a Honduran newspaper reported that her 'Angels' stunt double had shot herself, and several sites misread the news. Smith took to Twitter and Facebook to dispel the false reports. "Jaclyn is safe and home with her family. She is not in Honduras. It is a lie."<ref>[http://www.popcrunch.com/jaclyn-smith-dead-jaclyn-smith-suicide-death-hoax/ "Jaclyn Smith Dead? Jaclyn Smith Suicide Death Hoax"], PopCrunch, September 22, 2009</ref> *'''[[Mark E. Smith]]''' was erroneously reported dead by the BBC in March 2017 on his 60th birthday.<ref>[http://www.nme.com/news/music/mark-e-smith-bbc-death-error-birthday-tweet-2003907] "BBC Accidentally Reports Death of The Fall's Mark E Smith"], NME, March 6, 2017</ref> Smith died in January 2018. *'''[[George Soros]]''' On April 18, 2013, [[Reuters]] reported that billionaire financier George Soros had died. The report, which was taken down after 30 minutes stated that "George Soros, who died XXX at age XXX, was a predatory and hugely successful financier and investor, who argued paradoxically for years against the same sort of free-wheeling capitalism that made him billions," and many other "less than flattering things" [[The Guardian]] reported. The report was quickly taken down, and Reuters soon released a statement saying "Reuters erroneously published an advance obituary of financier and philanthropist George Soros. A spokesman for Soros said that the New York-based financier is alive and well. Reuters regrets the error."<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/business/2013/apr/19/reuters-george-soros-obituary-premature-publication|title=Red-faced Reuters prematurely publishes George Soros obituary|last=Neville|first=Simon|date=April 19, 2013|newspaper=The Guardian|language=en-GB|issn=0261-3077|access-date=December 12, 2016}}</ref> *'''[[Britney Spears]]''' and then-boyfriend '''[[Justin Timberlake]]''' (musicians) were reported to have died in a car crash by two Texas DJs as a joke in 2001. The radio station ([[KEGL]]) was sued and the DJs were fired. The car crash story is thought to have originated as a rumour on the Internet.<ref>[http://archives.cnn.com/2001/SHOWBIZ/Music/06/13/spears.rumor/index.html "Britney Spears death rumor travels around world"] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20070307120107/http://archives.cnn.com/2001/SHOWBIZ/Music/06/13/spears.rumor/index.html |date=March 7, 2007 }}, [[CNN]], June 13, 2001.</ref> Spears was the victim of another death hoax on December 26, 2016, when someone hacked Sony Music's and Bob Dylan's Twitter account, and posted tweets claiming that she had died.<ref>[http://edition.cnn.com/2016/12/26/entertainment/britney-spears-death-hoax/ "Britney Spears victimized by Twitter hoax claiming she had died"], CNN, December 26, 2016.</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.dailytelegraph.com.au/news/breaking-news/false-tweets-as-sony-music-twitter-hacked/news-story/0d23b3fbc0536f93562bfe7d81d2f9d1|title=False tweets as Sony Music Twitter hacked|access-date=December 28, 2016}}</ref> *{{anchor|Sylvester Stallone}}'''[[Sylvester Stallone]]''': The actor was subject to an Internet death hoax on September 3, 2016.<ref>Hood, Micaela (September 5, 2016). [http://www.nydailynews.com/entertainment/sylvester-stallone-victim-celebrity-death-hoax-article-1.2779081 Sylvester Stallone victim of celebrity death hoax]. ''New York Daily News''. Retrieved September 7, 2016.</ref> In February 2018, with another hoax circulating, he posted to Instagram that he was alive.<ref>{{citation|title=Sylvester Stallone is alive and 'still punching' despite death hoax|work=Entertainment Weekly|date=February 19, 2018|url=http://ew.com/news/2018/02/19/sylvester-stallone-alive-death-hoax/}}</ref> *'''Ronald Stan''': In 1977, this 32-year-old Canadian man mysteriously vanished. It was speculated that he may have died in a fire, and he was officially declared dead in 1986. However, in 2014, investigators found that Stan was alive and residing in Oklahoma under the name Jeff Walton. Relatives reported that Stan had a wife and children in Canada at the time of his disappearance, but in the intervening years he had apparently married another woman and started a family. His Oklahoman relatives reported that they had no knowledge of his previous identity. However, in a bizarre twist, at least one Canadian relative claimed to have known that Stan was alive all this time, and was shocked to learn that he had been declared dead. Stan's motive for disappearing was not immediately known.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.aol.com/article/2014/08/26/man-missing-since-1977-found-in-oklahoma-using-new-name/20952745/|title=Man Missing Since 1977 Found In Oklahoma Using New Name – AOL.com|work=AOL Article}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.huffingtonpost.com/2014/08/26/ronald-stan-missing_n_5718535.html|title=Canadian Man Ronald Stan, Missing For 37 Years, Found In Oklahoma|work=The Huffington Post}}</ref> *'''[[Martha Stewart (actress)]]''': Stewart was falsely reported dead in February 2012 by [[Variety (magazine)|Variety]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.altfg.com/film/martha-stewart-death/|title=Martha Stewart Not Dead?|publisher=}}</ref> *'''[[Randall L. Stephenson]]''': On July 26, 2009, the AT&T CEO was falsely reported as having died after falling into a coma following a massive cocaine binge during a party at his mansion.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.cnet.com/news/at-t-said-to-block-4chan-pranksters-fight-back/|title=AT&T said to block 4chan; pranksters fight back|date=July 27, 2009|publisher=|accessdate=April 23, 2018}}</ref> The report originated from CNN's iReport website, although it was later taken down. Although the hackers who created the false report have never been identified, it is suspected that they were 4chan users who did the hack in retaliation for AT&T's decision to block the site for its broadband customers, a decision which had been provoked by an earlier denial-of-service attack against one of AT&T's customers that originated from a 4chan user. Access to 4chan on AT&T broadband services has since been restored. *'''[[John Stonehouse]]''' MP: in 1974 the British politician [[Pseudocide|faked his own suicide]] (by drowning in Miami) in order to escape financial difficulties and marry his mistress. He was subsequently discovered in Australia – where initially police thought he might be [[Richard Bingham, 7th Earl of Lucan|Lord Lucan]] – and imprisoned.<ref>[http://www.findarticles.com/p/articles/mi_qn4158/is_20051229/ai_n15983974 Milmo C.: "The man who faked his death"] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20080312135117/http://findarticles.com/p/articles/mi_qn4158/is_20051229/ai_n15983974 |date=March 12, 2008 }}, ''[[The Independent]]'', December 29, 2005.</ref> Stonehouse died April 14, 1988. *'''[[Red Storey]]''': the Canadian football player and ice hockey referee was reported dead by a Montreal radio station in the 1970s when a ''[[Montreal Star]]'' employee misheard another saying "Red's story is dead" (referring to sports editor [[Red Fisher (journalist)|Red Fisher]]). The employee told his wife, who phoned the radio station – which then broadcast the 'news' without checking it.<ref>[http://www.canada.com/montrealgazette/news/sports/story.html?id=c1d69eaa-c803-42ec-8aaf-bc3a8015951b&p=2 Fisher, R.: "Storey a man of talents and tales"] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20070929213810/http://www.canada.com/montrealgazette/news/sports/story.html?id=c1d69eaa-c803-42ec-8aaf-bc3a8015951b&p=2 |date=September 29, 2007 }}, ''[[Montreal Gazette]]'', March 16, 2006.</ref> Storey died on March 15, 2006. *'''Sven-Olof Svensson''': this 81-year-old Swedish man was reported dead in 2014 by the [[Jönköpings-Posten|Jonkopings-Posten]] after his sister reported his death when he was taken into the hospital "unwell".<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.huffingtonpost.com/2014/01/20/sven-olof-svensson_n_4631900.html|title=Man Reads Own Obituary In Newspaper|last=Moye|first=David|last2=|first2=|date=January 20, 2014|website=The Huffington Post|publisher=|access-date=January 18, 2017}}</ref> *'''[[Dave Swarbrick]]''': the folk musician's obituary was published in the ''[[Daily Telegraph]]'' in April 1999 after he was admitted to hospital with a chest infection, prompting the quip: "It's not the first time I have died in Coventry."<ref>[http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/entertainment/324097.stm "Paper kills off musician by mistake"], [[BBC]] News web site, April 20, 1999.</ref> Swarbrick died in 2016.
==T== [[File:Twain1909.jpg|thumb|[[Mark Twain]]: "The report of my death was an exaggeration".]]
*'''[[Shashi Tharoor]]''': Times Now tweeted that the Indian politician Shashi Tharoor has died on December 12, 2017, after the death of actor and producer [[Shashi Kapoor]]. Tharoor tweeted in response "We're getting condolence calls in the office! Reports of my demise are, if not exaggerated, at least premature."<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://twitter.com/ShashiTharoor/status/937669874624618497|title=We're getting condolence calls in the office! Reports of my demise are, if not exaggerated, at least premature. @TimesNow #ShashiKapoorhttps://twitter.com/thehungrytide/status/937669285673041921 ...|last=Tharoor|first=Shashi|date=<!--5:08 AM - -->December 4, 2017|website=@ShashiTharoor|language=en|accessdate=December 4, 2017}}</ref> *'''[[Margaret Thatcher]]''': Text-message reports of Baroness Thatcher's death caused a stir at a 2009 Canadian political event, and officials in Prime Minister [[Stephen Harper]]'s office were preparing to issue a statement of condolence, until it was determined that the deceased Thatcher in question was actually Transport Minister [[John Baird (Canadian politician)|John Baird]]'s cat.<ref>[https://www.theguardian.com/world/2009/nov/13/thatcher-cat-death-canada Kennedy, Maev. "Thatcher's dead – that's moggy, not Maggie."] ''[[The Guardian]]'', November 13, 2009.</ref> Thatcher actually died on April 8, 2013. *'''[[Orlando Thomas]]''': A former professional [[American football|football]] player afflicted with [[Lou Gehrig's Disease]], Thomas was incorrectly reported as dead by the official website of the [[Minnesota Vikings]], his former team, on October 28, 2009.<ref name=craig>Craig, Mark. "[http://www.startribune.com/sports/vikings/67053502.html?elr=KArksLckD8EQDUoaEyqyP4O:DW3ckUiD3aPc:_Yyc:aUycaEacyUs Vikings' website report citing Thomas' death was incorrect]{{dead link|date=September 2017 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}", The Minneapolis Star Tribune, October 29, 2009.</ref> The story of Thomas's death was then picked up and re-reported by various news services, including the [[Associated Press]].<ref name=ap_orlando_thomas_obit>"[https://www.google.com/hostednews/ap/article/ALeqM5h8kzWG698jy-BwmuTpLW8dmYlDQwD9BKFOF01 STORY REMOVED: FBN—Obit-Vikings-Thomas]", The Associated Press, October 28, 2009.</ref> He later died in 2014. *'''[[Donald Walter Trautman]]''' (Bishop of the [[Roman Catholic Diocese of Erie]], [[Pennsylvania]]) was reported dead in the edition of April 4, 2007 of the [[Holy See|Vatican]] newspaper ''[[L'Osservatore Romano]]''; in fact it was his predecessor Bishop Michael Murphy who had just died. "I told people that there was an early resurrection", Trautman said. ''[[The Tablet]]'' printed a cartoon about the incident, depicting one angel at a reception desk telling another: "Bishop Trautman's just e-mailed us with a cancellation."<ref name="Bruce">{{Cite news| last=Bruce| first=David | title=Report of bishop's death a whopper| date=June 3, 2007| publisher=[[Erie Times-News]]| accessdate=December 8, 2007| url=http://www.goerie.com/apps/pbcs.dll/article?AID=/20070603/LIFESTYLES07/706030414&SearchID=73285866207720}}</ref> *'''[[Stephanie Tubbs Jones]]''': The [[Cleveland, Ohio]], congresswoman was incorrectly reported as having died August 20, 2008 after suffering an [[aneurysm]]. The report prompted an official statement from [[John Kerry]] mourning her death. Tubbs Jones did however, die later that day.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.foxnews.com/wires/2008Aug20/0,4670,CongresswomanHospitalized,00.html|title=US Rep. Tubbs Jones of Ohio dies after hemorrhage|work=Fox News}}</ref> * '''[[Mark Twain]]''': American author, was reported dead twice: # In 1897 when a journalist was sent to inquire after Twain's health, thinking he was near death; in fact it was his cousin who was very ill. Although (contrary to popular belief) no obituary was published, Twain recounted the event in the ''[[New York Journal]]'' of June 2, 1897, including his famous words "The report of my death was an exaggeration" (which is usually misquoted, e.g. as "The rumours of my death have been greatly exaggerated", or "Reports of my death are greatly exaggerated").<ref>[http://www.twainquotes.com/interviews/interviewindex2006b.html "Comprehensive publication list of known interviews with... Mark Twain"], TwainQuotes.com</ref><ref>Powers, R.: ''Mark Twain: A Life''. Free Press, New York. 2005.</ref> # On May 4, 1907, when people lost track of a yacht he was traveling on, ''[[The New York Times]]'' published an article saying he might have been lost at sea.<ref>[[s:The New York Times/Twain and yacht disappear at sea|Twain and yacht disappear at sea]], ''[[The New York Times]]'', May 4, 1907.</ref> In fact, the yacht had been held up by fog, and Twain had disembarked. Twain read the article, and cleared up the story by writing a humorous account in ''The New York Times'' the following day.<ref>[[s:The New York Times/Mark Twain Investigating|Mark Twain Investigating]], ''[[The New York Times]]'', May 5, 1907.</ref> : Twain died in 1910.
==U== *'''[[Ishinosuke Uwano]]''': in April 2006 this Japanese soldier, missing since World War II, was found to be living in Ukraine aged 83, where he had married and had a family. He had been officially declared dead in 2000.
